Workflow.WorkStageName:
The function of this screen is to **verify whether registered or modified items have been properly applied** through an **inquiry transaction**.
① Users can enter search criteria to retrieve specific records.
② The system displays the relevant details of the registered or modified items.
③ Users can review the information to confirm accuracy and completeness.
④ If discrepancies are found, further modifications can be made through the appropriate update process.

The function of this screen is to **verify whether registered or modified items have been properly applied** through an **inquiry transaction**.
① Users can enter search criteria to retrieve specific records.
② The system displays the relevant details of the registered or modified items.
③ Users can review the information to confirm accuracy and completeness.
④ If discrepancies are found, further modifications can be made through the appropriate update process.
Are there any modifications required?

The function of this screen is to **modify approval reason codes** used for managerial authorization.
① Users can view existing approval reason codes and their details.
② They can update, delete, or add new codes based on approval policies.
③ The system ensures that all modifications comply with predefined authorization rules.
④ Once changes are made, they must be confirmed and saved to take effect.
**Do you want to delete the reason code for manager approval?**

The function of this screen is to **delete code** by updating its status.
① **Switch to modify mode** to enable editing.
② **Change the code's status** to **"DELETE"** to mark it for removal.
③ The system will process the deletion based on this updated status.

The function of this screen is to **mapping an approval reason code to each transaction ID**.
① The system retrieves the transaction details.
② Users select or input the appropriate **approval reason code** for the transaction.
③ The system validates the selected code against predefined rules.
④ Upon confirmation, the approval reason code is **assigned to the transaction ID** and stored in the system.

The function of this screen is to **verify whether registered or modified items have been properly applied** through an **inquiry transaction**.
① Retrieve the relevant records based on specified search criteria.
② Review the details of the registered or modified items.
**Is there any change to be made in the relationship between the transaction and the responsible approver reason code?**

The function of this screen is to **modify the relationship between approval reason codes and transaction IDs**.
① Users can **view, edit, or update** the approval reason codes assigned to specific transactions.
② The system ensures that all **modifications are validated** before saving changes.
③ Users can **search for transactions** using various filters, such as transaction ID, approval code, or approval status.
"Do you want to cancel the relationship between the **Transaction** and the **Responsible Approver Reason Code**?"

The function of this screen is to **modify the approval status** of a transaction marked for deletion.
① **Switch to modify mode** to enable editing.
② Update the **approval reason status** to **'CANCEL'** to proceed with the deletion process.

The function of this screen is to **inquire about approval lines assigned to users** through a designated transaction.
① The system retrieves approval line details linked to each user.
② Users can view structured approval hierarchies and authorization levels.
Is an approval line in workflow?

The function of this screen is to **configure and register approval lines** for business transactions and document workflows.
① Users can define **multiple approval stages** and assign approvers based on organizational hierarchy or specific roles.
② The system allows for **customizing approval sequences**, ensuring compliance with internal policies.

The function of this screen is to **verify** whether the **registered or modified items** have been successfully applied through an **inquiry transaction**.
① Users can perform an inquiry transaction to retrieve and review the latest status of the registered or modified data.
② The system fetches and displays the relevant details, allowing users to confirm the accuracy of the applied changes.
Are there any modifications required?

The function of this screen is to **modify the approval line details** in the system.
① Users can view the existing approval line and make necessary adjustments.
② They can **add, remove, or reorder approvers** based on organizational requirements.
delete the **approval line**?

The function of this screen is to **delete an approval line** by updating its status. ① **Switch to modify mode** to enable editing.
② Change the **status** of the approval line to **'DELETE'** to mark it for removal.

The function of this screen is to **inquire the approval history** of transactions or requests that require managerial authorization.
① Users can search for past approval records based on various criteria such as date, approver, or transaction type.
② The screen displays key details, including approval status, timestamps, and any comments provided by the approver.
Attempt a transaction
Is the transaction approved by a manager?
Is the **approval request** being processed correctly?
**Is the approval reason code registered?**
Is the **transaction ID** mapped to the **approval reason code**?
"Is the approval line registered?"
contact the system administrator
register the approval reason code
register the approval line
map transaction IDs with approval reason codes
Does multiple approval lines exist?
select an approval line
The **requester** submits a request for ** approval**.
**Approver**: Approves or rejects an **approval request**.
